intro: Lippia pseudothea, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Lippia pseudothea is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
